revised_title: Earthquake Felt Near Bury St. Edmund and Narborough: A Firsthand Account
tldr: In 1749, an earthquake was felt near Bury St. Edmund in Suffolk and Narborough in Leicestershire. Lady Cornwallis and Miss Charlotte Cornwallis experienced the shaking in their rooms, while others in the house did not. The earthquake was also reported at Narborough Church, causing the congregation to fear the roof would collapse. This firsthand account provides a detailed description of the event and its effects on the people involved.
